content: @Dagur Asgeirsson 's #13170 removes an instance that was mistakenly made global during the port and starts the clean up. It significantly speeds up CI since simp is more efficient. I touched it too much to merge.
See more history at #mathlib4 > ConcreteCategory.instFunLike became a global instance

Am I allowed to merge? I think I started the branch.

It would be good to get this in. Despite it being a backwards step in some ways (lots of erw) I think it is a prerequisite for moving forward cleaning up algebraic geometry.
For these PRs that introduce "technical debt", it may be useful to create a separate tracking issue for people to contribute to (and perhaps mark the erws with the issue #).
The erws are already marked with the PR #
I opened the issue #13342, but I'm not really what to do with it. I'll at least link to it in the PR description
There are unresolved conversations, all of a trivial nature, and my finger was hovering over the merge button ready to click the moment they were resolved!

The reason I suggested the separate issue was so it could explain specifically what needs to be done. My understanding is that erws are effectively utilizing "defeq" abuse and suggest we have missing simp lemmas, but I'm not sure what mathlib's official stance on erw is (when they can or can't be used). It would be useful to have the issue explain why this is "technical debt". I also suggested marking the erws with the issue # to make it easier for people to find instruction on what to fix (and potentially how to fix it).
